html: Happy #LancashireDay! It's held to mark the anniversary of #Lancashire sending its first representatives to Parliament in 1295. 723 year on, find out which MPs Lancastrians have elected to represent them today. Wherever you live, you can #FindYourMP at http://www.parliament.uk/findyourmp pic.twitter.com/BOesRuDsYa
text:
Happy #LancashireDay!

It's held to mark the anniversary of #Lancashire sending its first representatives to Parliament in 1295. 723 year on, find out which MPs Lancastrians have elected to represent them today.

Wherever you live, you can #FindYourMP at http://www.parliament.uk/findyourmp pic.twitter.com/BOesRuDsYa

html: 8,586,000 soldiers from the British Empire were enlisted to help Britain during WW1. Around 1,780,000 of these soldiers were from India. Khudadad Khan was the first Indian soldier awarded a Victoria Cross. This year the British Legion has released the special 'Khadi' poppy.pic.twitter.com/TKtHnFqp2e
text:
8,586,000 soldiers from the British Empire were enlisted to help Britain during WW1.

Around 1,780,000 of these soldiers were from India.

Khudadad Khan was the first Indian soldier awarded a Victoria Cross.

This year the British Legion has released the special 'Khadi' poppy.pic.twitter.com/TKtHnFqp2e

html: At St Symphorien I had the honour of laying wreaths at the graves of John Parr and George Ellison, the first and last UK soldiers to die during the War. html: From April [the #NationalLivingWage] will rise again, by 4.9%, from £7.83 to £8.21… …handing a full-time worker a further £690 annual pay increase… …and taking his or her total pay-rise, since the introduction to over £2,750 a year. #Budget2018pic.twitter.com/VEPhoLj0do

html: The Chancellor has announced that until 2021 all pubs with a rateable value of below £51,000 will have their business rates cut by a third. This is great news and will save the pub industry £130m over 2 years #Budget2018 #Beer #Pubs #BusinessRates

html: Funny exchange at an apartment today while canvassing Me: knock Voter: thank God you're here Me: really? Why? Voter: yes because you're here to fix my tv Me : no I'm the mayor of ottawa Voter: well that's no use to me
text:
Funny exchange at an apartment today while canvassing 

Me: knock
Voter: thank God you're here
Me: really? Why? 
Voter: yes because you're here to fix my tv
Me : no I'm the mayor of ottawa
Voter: well that's no use to me

html: Did you know: BIDs run for 5 years and are not-for-profit bodies which seek to improve business within a defined area.? The Board exists to ensure the business plan is delivered efficiently to give the best value for the levy payers, who pay 1.5% of their total rateable value.

text:
Calling 999 is no joke. A few calls that we shouldn’t have received on 999 today:

• My friend has stolen my football 
• 20 golf balls in the road
• Pandora charm lost 
• Girlfriends dog is missing 
• Hoax calls to 999
• Lost house keys

#NoLaughingMatter

html: Little remarked, but UK Corporation Tax revenue in the last twelve months hit an all-time record high of £58.3bn today: up £10bn compared to the same period just two years ago. Corporation Tax cuts create jobs, raise wages, increase savings, and - yes - boost government revenue.
text:
Little remarked, but UK Corporation Tax revenue in the last twelve months hit an all-time record high of £58.3bn today: up £10bn compared to the same period just two years ago.

Corporation Tax cuts create jobs, raise wages, increase savings, and - yes - boost government revenue.

html: Great UK jobs news: Unemployment down to 4%: the lowest since 1975 and halved since 2010. Zero-hour contracts down 104,000 in the last year. More job vacancies than at any time on record. Average wages up 2.7% in the last year. Labour productivity up 1.5% in the last year.
text:
Great UK jobs news:

Unemployment down to 4%: the lowest since 1975 and halved since 2010.

Zero-hour contracts down 104,000 in the last year.

More job vacancies than at any time on record.

Average wages up 2.7% in the last year.

Labour productivity up 1.5% in the last year.

html: At 0737hrs today, a car was in collision with barriers outside the Houses of Parliament. The male driver of the car was detained by officers at the scene. A number of pedestrians have been injured. Officers remain at the scene. We will issue further info when we have it.

html: The Berlin Wall went up on this day #OTD in 1961. Thankfully, it's now been down longer than it was ever up, but still a reminder of the tyranny of Soviet socialism. My photos from March 1987. html: Back in UK & surprised about the Taiwan pork agreement row. To be clear, this is a UK bilateral deal (not EU) & doesn’t expire on Brexit date. How do I know? Stats out earlier this week show CPI inflation was 2.4% in June.

 cutting income taxes 
 freezing fuel duty 
capping energy pricespic.twitter.com/sxd6m4cewj
